metadata.title: CVE-2014-8625 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description: Multiple format string vulnerabilities in the parse_error_msg function inparsehelp.c in dpkg before 1.17.22 allow remote attackers to cause a denialof service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via format stringspecifiers in the (1) package or (2) architecture name.

criterions.comment: dpkg package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
